title: Game-Based Language Learning Design: Enhancing Expression and Reading Comprehension through Experience-Centered Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and substantial practical experience in specialized fields, foundational grammar/vocabulary comprehension, and communication skills
context.additional_context: Intensive language training using mobile devices and game-based learning tools, providing a contextual language-learning environment through multimodal inputs (text, audio, images).

learning_goals: Learners experience real-world language use (listening, speaking, reading, writing) in classroom/daily conversation scenarios through in-game simulations
Using in-game feedback systems, learners correct ≥80% of grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation errors and acquire self-correction strategies

In three team-based game missions over one week, learners meet ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation criteria (pronunciation accuracy, grammatical appropriateness, vocabulary diversity, communicative fluency, cultural appropriateness) and apply ≥2 collaborative learning strategies (role division, feedback sharing, error correction support) to achieve ≥80% mission success rate
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
